main event: A spherical, silver object approximately four feet in diameter appeared to be blown by a light wind, landing against a 100-foot fence where it began to evaporate or disintegrate.
interesting points: The object emitted a violet-colored vapor as it landed.
There was physical evidence of the substance and material upon which the object landed.
The object's movement was described as an oscillation with a ground description.
The case was similar to a previous sighting of what was determined to be soap bubbles in Baltimore on February 22, 1955.
The investigator was in possession of physical evidence from the sighting.
sighted object: A spherical, silver object approximately four feet in diameter
